p: The aroma and taste of virgin olive oil (VOO) are key characteristics that distinguish it from other culinary oils, and given that VOO is the only food product to undergo sensory analysis for classification ( Commission Regulation No. (2568)/91,1991), these sensory properties are commercially important. Classification of VOO is regulated by the ( Commission Regulation No. (2568)/91(1991) and is carried out by trained and authorized test panels that evaluate green and fruity odors, typical of healthy and freshly extracted VOO, and intensity of bitterness and pungency of the oils.
